comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/61271636@N05] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] 

I remember riding over the bidge in these carriages in the late fifties - these were known as the "Bradfield Cars". Riding near (or in) an open doorway in the underground was an experience we all enjoyed!

comment.author: 28304000@N00
comment._content: The last Bradfield cars remained in service until the early 70's.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/61271636@N05][http://www.flickr.com/photos/28304000@N00] Maybe we have become just a little 'precious' when it comes to OH&S? In any case the lovely wide doors in the Sydney electric cars were just made for us despatch boys as we rattled around town delivering parcels for our companies in the days before couriers and email! The trip from Wynyard to Central was quite an 'adventure' - I lalways took the long way 'round and back, via the Quay!  We also had a couple of clients in North Sydney - a trip over the bridge standing in the doorway was sensational!

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/61271636@N05] I'd disagree with the last statement ... some of the station son the Illawarra Line would get my vote

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/61271636@N05] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/albert3801] Riding on trains sounds like one big adventure, thanks for sharing!

AB

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: ? looks like that's Dorman Long & Co's Director of Construction Lawrence Ennis standing beside Bradfield...there's a better pic of him here - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... ; and here - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=9974
